attributes.action: Abolish the 4 hour waiting time target for NHS Accident & Emergency Departments
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government's target for a maximum waiting time of 4 hours for patients to be admitted, transferred or discharged  in NHS Accident & Emergency (A&E) departments is arbitrary and distorts clinical priorities.
 
There is no scientific or clinical evidence behind the choice of 4 hours as a universal upper limit.

This 4-hour A&E target is one of the most damaging NHS targets because meeting the target has become the priority in many NHS trusts, not the provision of high quality medical care in a time frame appropriate to the clinical condition.

How long a patient waits should be decided by clinical staff on the frontline in our hard-pressed A&E departments, not from the offices of the Department of Health.

The 4-hour A&E waiting time target is perverse and should be scrapped.
